    • Field Detail

      • BORDER_VISITED

        private static final int BORDER_VISITED
        The maze is drawn with an extra row on the top and bottom, and an extra column on the left and right. This simplifies the creation of the maze. Because we want to maintain a "visit" count for standard cells We need a default visit count for the border cells.
        See Also:

        private int _numRows
        The number of rows in the maze

      • _northWalls

        private boolean[][] _northWalls
        This is a 2-Dimensional array. Each x,y position in the array will hold the value true if a wall is present in the North direction or false if the wall is down.

      • _eastWalls

        private boolean[][] _eastWalls
        This is a 2-Dimensional array. Each x,y position in the array will hold the value true if a wall is present in the East direction or false if the wall is down.

      • _southWalls

        private boolean[][] _southWalls
        This is a 2-Dimensional array. Each x,y position in the array will hold the value true if a wall is present in the South direction or false if the wall is down.

      • _westWalls

        private boolean[][] _westWalls
        This is a 2-Dimensional array. Each x,y position in the array will hold the value true if a wall is present in the West direction or false if the wall is down.

      • _visitCount

        private int[][] _visitCount
        This is a 2-Dimensional array. Each x,y position in the array will hold the number of times the cell has been visited.

      • _visited

        private boolean[][] _visited
        This is a 2-Dimensional array. Each x,y position in the array will hold a true/false value indicating if the cell has been visited.

      • done

        private boolean done

        public Maze()
        Create the Maze object. Prepare the stack of actively used cells

    • Method Detail

      • resetMaze

        public void resetMaze(int x,
                      int y)
        Parameters:
        x - The number of columns in the maze
        y - The number of rows in the maze Here we prepare the maze to be recreated.

      • prepMaze

        private void prepMaze(int x,
                      int y)
        Parameters:
        x - The number of columns in the maze
        y - The number of rows in the maze Here we store the maze dimensions and calculate the pixel dimensions of each cell.

      • initializeBorder

        private void initializeBorder()
        Create the maze larger than needed by 2 rows and 2 columns. 1 row extra on top and bottom. 1 column extra left and right.

        Build the Maze
